p: Thus, cleaner energy can both reduce climate change and simultaneously save lives endangered by air pollution. In addition, obesity, diabetes, heart disease, and cancer, which are in part related to physical inactivity [ 17], may be reduced by a switch to low-carbon transportâ€”including walking and cycling. Furthermore, the health benefits of clean air may far outweigh the investment costs of clean energy technologies, providing additional economic incentives for mitigation activities [ 18]. In the United States, a life cycle analysis found that the health benefits of a national low-carbon energy plan would offset energy investment costs by between 26% and 1,050% [ 19]. In PLOS Medicine, Woodcock and colleagues estimate the health and economic benefits that could accrue from increasing the number of cyclists in the United Kingdom, and provide a decision support tool for local health officials and urban planners tasked with preparing the built environment for healthier communities [ 20].
